Player History
Had first career hit on 4/5/1965, off Bob Veale (PIT)...
Earned first career win on 5/5/1965...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1969...
Signed as a free agent by California on 2/4/1971 to a 1-year deal worth $2,123,212 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 2/2/1972 to a 3-year deal worth $2,750,000 per year...
Drafted in 4th round, 65th overall pick, by Pittsburgh in 1975...
Injured on 4/30/1979 with a Broken Hip, out for full season...
Had first career hit on 4/3/1981, off Bert Blyleven (STL)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/4/1981, off Mike Proly (STL)...
Drove in 6 runs against St. Louis on 4/4/1981...
Hit 3 homeruns against San Francisco, driving in 9 runs on 5/23/1981...
Won Rookie of the Year Award in 1981, hitting .257 with 32 HR, 104 RBI...
Was selected to the 1982 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against San Francisco on 7/15/1982...
Injured on 4/19/1985 with a Inflamed Anterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 5-6 weeks...
Injured on 7/11/1989 with a Dislocated Shoulder, out for 7 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by New York (N) on 2/6/1990 to a 1-year deal worth $1,500,000 per year...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Houston on 6/7/1990...
Injured on 8/3/1990 with a Fractured Jaw, out for 4 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 2/21/1991 to a 1-year deal worth $2,500,000 per year...
